description: What to do if you receive a Penalty Charge Notice for a contravention from before you owned the vehicle

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["You may receive a Penalty Charge Notice (PCN) for a contravention that occurred before you were the registered keeper of the vehicle or before you bought your car."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

If we cannot match the image of a vehicle registration to our database, we contact the DVLA and ask for details of the vehicle and the recorded registered keeper. If the DVLA details have not been updated after the sale of a vehicle, the wrong person may receive a PCN.
Whether you're buying or selling a vehicle it is your joint responsibility to ensure the DVLA records for the vehicle are updated.

You can make a representation to let us know you were not liable for the PCN(s) and provide details of the previous owner. However, if they fail to pay a PCN for a vehicle you now possess, your vehicle may be immobilised or removed.
If you are considering buying a vehicle, you can check whether it is subject to any outstanding PCNs by emailing the following information to outstandingccpenaltycharges@tfl.gov.uk :

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Your full name and address for identification purposes","An email address for the information to be sent to","The complete vehicle registration number (only one per enquiry is permitted)","Confirmation that you have the explicit consent of the current registered keeper of the vehicle (or, if unregistered, the owner of the vehicle) for the information to be sent to you"]}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["The address above should only be used for checking a vehicle being bought","\u003cstrong\u003eWe can only confirm if there are outstanding red route penalty charges\u003c/strong\u003e ","Further details of any outstanding penalty charges can only be given to the person deemed liable for those penalties"]}
If you want to make a representation against any PCNs you have already received you should follow the instructions on the PCN.
